intro: Persicaria segetum, commonly known as field smartweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, with reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are greenish-white with a distinct bract at the base, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Persicaria segetum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in agricultural fields.
